data.title: Schilb Antiquarian
data.text:
Annibale Marchese’s “Il Viticondo” is a rare 18th-century Italian poem written for the wedding of Charles III King of Spain to Maria Amalia of Saxony. The marriage allowed Charles III to become King of Naples and Maria Amalia the Queen of Spain, Naples, and Sicily. Marchese’s poem was popular throughout Europe and became an icon for celebrating the union of the House of Bourbon and Saxony. This 1738 first edition was published in conjunction with the wedding and is considerably rare with no other examples found for sale worldwide!

1738 Wedding Charles III 1ed Il Viticondo Marchese Spain Naples Sicily Bourbon

This 1738 first edition was published in conjunction with the wedding and is considerably rare with no other examples found for sale worldwide!
